March 20, 1951
Mr. A. Frank Reel
National Executive Secretary
American Federation of Radio Artists
15 West 44th Street
New York, 18, New York
Dear Mr. Reel:
I am in receipt of a copy of your letter to Mr. Charter
Heslep of the United States Atomic Energy Commission regarding
the use of the series of programs on atomic energy which were
done by Station Y/L3 in Chicago.
Attached you will find a list of the stations affiliated
with the NAEB which are interested in broadcasting these programs.
A second list of stations indicates those which do nin-schoolw
broadcasting and are therefore interested in having permission
to keep copies of the programs on hand for reuse. As you are
no doubt aware in the case of school broadcasting, it is well
nigh impossible to get all classes to listen at any one time.
Thus necessitating the rebroadcast of each program several times.
The majority of stations are interested in permission
to use the series as single broadcasts. Only those indicated
are interested in keeping a copy for additional use. V*e sincerely
hope that you will give your earnest consideration to this request.
If your approval is secured, we will make up a schedule of
stations and the dates on which they will eventually use these
programs. If you are interested, we would be happy to send you
a copy of this final schedule.
Thank you for your splendid cooperation.
Cordially yours,
Richard L. Rider
Manager
NAEB Tape Network
